Review: It was really good. The fight scenes were great! Characters and the story was very interesting even though I knew Natasha's fate in Endgame. Two things I loved the most about this movie are: 1) the fight was against a system and they didn't just defeat one bad guy, they actually freed those girls and their fight did really make a difference; 2) I loved that in the end Natasha is happy and in the Endgame she died knowing she had people who loved her because after so much suffering she deserved that. Taskmaster had some cool scenes but it didn't live up to the mcu villian standard. The second and third act felt rushed and forced. Author: quick-39526
Review: I was going into the movie expecting the same old generic Marvel movie, but instead I got more than that.. in some ways. I'm very happy with the result. This movie is not only a great Marvel movie, but a good movie altogether. Because, unlike a lot of Marvel movies, it does feel like there are stakes, a key thing missing in a lot of the MCU. Part of that is because of the Spy/Thriller elements to this movie that keep the tone darker when necessary, and incorporate some good sets, but also because of the heart and emotion in this movie, that is conveyed through the trauma each of the main characters have to deal with (somewhat), and their connectivity as a "family". Each of the characters do have a lot of the witty humour, but it doesn't come across as being so formulaic here, instead it's actually funny and only used appropriately. Along with that the characters are individual and each have real stakes in the story, although most are lacking proper depth. This movie also has a lot of really engaging Spy/Thriller elements, more akin to the Mission: Impossible films, which gives it a more unique tone for an MCU movie and makes for some great action sequences. The main villain serves his purpose in the story, and provides a shadow of mystery and a looming sense of threat, before he is introduced to be ruthless and cold, making for a decent antagonist. However, what brings this movie down is that it presents so many potentially complex and dark themes, but as usual with the MCU, it doesn't fully engage with the concepts presented, and thus gives the characters less depth. Other than that, this is a solid action flick that goes beyond most Marvel films and is sure to entertain.

Author: ianbohm
Review_Title: Great acting, okay movie, bad plot, horrible soundtrack.
Review: I watched this movie a few days ago and hoped that it was just the first impact, I quickly realised that this was not the case. Lets start with the opening, I loved it, I thought Natasha's blue hair seemed strange but I could make my peace with it, the dialogue however... for some odd reason Yelena's mother was explaining the science of fireflies, again strange but I could ignore it, David Harbour was awesome, he was one of my favourite non MCU actors and I was excited when I heard he was casted for this role, after the fireflies incident everything about the introduction was great, it was suspenseful intense and was going great, until the over the top Deadpool 2 level credit sequence came by, I liked the Deadpool 2 sequence because it fit the character's theme and matched the over the top 4th wall breaking humour of the movie, but Black Widow isn't Deadpool, it was unbearable and hard to watch, the kids' acting was believable and kind of surprised me a bit. Then we move to the movie itself, the Civil War bit was entertaining and made sense since the movie takes place right after Civil War.

Author: su-morazzo
Review_Title: It's a great movie, but should have been release after civil war
Review: I am a big fan of Marvel movies and I have watched them all several times. In short, does this movie do black widow justice? No. And how could it? This is basically an origin movie to a side kick character that we already know dies... If this movie was launched when it should have... After Civil War, the impact would have been much different. And this is how I took it. I saw this movie, as if she was still alive in MCU, and this was a representation of what Natasha has always been... A support, a rock to anyone fighting beside her, while she struggles to make right for her past. Except that in this movie.. she finally does ( and we finally know what happened in Budapest). I think this is why so many take it as if she is the sidekick. Also, I wont lie, this movie is meant to give us a "replacement" to black widow. But Yelena is a badass and will be very exciting to see. Still the fighting/action scenes are quite nice. People are complaining but let's be honest.. weren't many Marvel movies predictable? CGI heavy?? Finally, the complaints about the villain... This villain isn't meant to transpire outside this single movie... People are asking Loki level.. Thanos level villains.. are you crazy?? You dont put a villain that literally required the Avengers to be formed, or reborned.. in comparisson to a simple human-villain, that in fact exists (which makes people just generally uncomfortable, unlike an alien villain-human trafficking is the no 1 business in the world and most are girls). At the end, the movie is great, it just gives us more of Natasha being Natasha, it gives us a release to know that she was loved by a family before the Avengers, it gives us fun action and a bit of that Marvel comedy sequences. She would've deserved this movie after civil war and a proper send off with a sequel but alas... Female hero movies are still an uphill battle. NOTHING to do with Wonder Women 2 (that was an embarrassment)

Author: sitinurhafizahmohdnoor
Review_Title: It Makes Sense to Its Character
Review: I see this movie from the perspective of Natasha. She's a great Russian spy. She's hardly trust people. She manipulated people easily and this sort of character is well portrayed in this movie. Her child background is fantastic. It describes why a person becomes very careful in trusting people. She barely knew her mum and she learns how to fake herself when she's still a child. I think it's very touching that she actually found someone to hold onto which is her fake sister, which also comes from the same background as her. That's how she develops this human traits that we all have which we called sympathy. The story kind of make me feel like it's very deep and emotional. It makes me feel like Natasha is the real heroes of all. I think the cinematography is well depicted for a person who's not an expert but somehow, it's really entertain my lockdown mood. I love the movie.

Author: toblerone-46305
Review: Black Widow wasn't really bad or anything, it was just really kind of dull. I thought that it started out actually really good but as it went along, it got worse and worse. Like at the beginning, it was everything i could've hoped for. It had great pacing, pretty good cinematography and fight choreography, and I actually really liked the music. It's just that...as it went along, it started to get really dull and honestly, by the end, it just gave me headache. I was just so not that invested in the story and it didn't do a really good job at actually making me care for the characters. It wasn't bad or anything...it was just weird and it didn't really do anything new. It was pretty tonally inconsistent too and it made me think to myself "wait what am I watching again?". By the end, it just became a huge mess as the music started blaring louder and louder with every explosion...there were a lot of explosions and it got really loud. Honestly, i'm not even annoyed or anything because the movie's still watchable and you can still have a good time with it...it just felt really weird and something felt really off with it. It actually had some great ideas too but the film executed them really strangely and honestly, it just left me really really confused throughout the entire third act. Like there was no substance or anything, there was no plot twist, no crazy reveals or anything, just a few moments that made me go "hey, that's pretty cool" before reverting back to my neutral state of not really knowing how to react. I don't think it's as bad as everyone's saying it is, it was honestly fine. I just wouldn't go to the theatre to watch it and it's really more the kind of thing you can watch just on your computer at 1AM because you have nothing better to do. So yeah, it was fun and I really liked it at times but all together, objectively as a film, it was really dull and pretty boring honestly. One could say it was the definition of mediocre.

Review_Title: What's with all the hatred? What the hell are these people looking for?
Review: It was too long I guess and it's true the movie is more about her sister (who is amazing in the movie), BUT the story was very good I thought. So it's not in top 5 Marvel movies but it's definitely better than Hulk and Captain Marvel. While that might not be saying much it was a very enjoyable movie. The family twists and turns were good and the action sequences were decent. I really expected Marvel to be headed downhill fast after the last Avengers movie, but with Far From Home and this movie they left me feeling like maybe they can keep it going for a while longer. I guess if you are looking for it to be a solid 9 or 10 you will be disappointed. But if you are looking to be entertained and enjoy amazing acting (by the rest of Black Widow's family) then you probably be glad you watched it. I don't understand the "garbage" reviews. It is far from garbage. A very good 7.5 movie.

Review_Title: Pugh was awesome but Marvel is slipping...
Review: This should have came out when Captain Marvel did, would have made so much more sense. Florence Pugh was great, but they ruined Taskmaster. If this is any indication of what is to come from Kevin Feige & Marvel, they have lost their edge and what made these films great. They need to go back to having creative teams that know & understand the source material, not ones that don't know anything beyond face value and think they can do a "better job & fix things". When you make Thor: The Dark World a better movie, you have failed. 5-1/2 stars.

Author: darrellpirkey
Review: Great cast, interesting story, Florence Pugh steals the movie. I, like so many others have been waiting for a Black Widow film. I enjoyed it, but with so many character introductions and a rich backstory for our characters that we only scratch the surface of, it feels incomplete. This would've been better as a limited series (Falcon & the Winter Soldier, Wandavision)

Author: jidov-mihai
Review: Almost fell asleep in the cinema watching this and wanted to just walk out at some point but decided to remain in the hope the it would change for the better. One of the most boring marvel movies out there with an uninteresting plot.

Author: reggieltd
Review: For the big effects and action sequences this 2 hour plus film gives you it leaves you pretty flat and unfulfilled. Scarlett Johansson was born to play the role of Black Widow but it looks as if the role is taking its toll on her as she pretty much sleep walks through the film. The great Rachel Weisz is hugely underused and David Harbour starts off as a troubled father/undercover agent then turns into some sort of bumbling aged superhero with one liners that are just not funny. Florence Pugh is about the only saving grace in this film acting wise but even her russian accent is as bad as the rest of the casts.

Appeared in Avengers franchise with some less notable contribution and footage. But when the character got chance to flourish herself Marvel pulled the chain again. In contrary, Captain Marvel got much better storyline than her. In my opinion this is a discrimination. The end of the story could really use some more logical actions.

Would definitely reccomend watching!

Author: saskiazoe
Review_Title: only mcu film i'll never watch again
Review: There was so much hype leading up to the release of this film, yet as I was watching it I just wanted to turn it off. Scarlett Johansson and Florence Pugh did a great job in portraying Natasha and Yelena, it was really great to be able to watch them grow up, and see some of the conditions they were put under. However, there really wasn't a decent plot, dare I say a plot at all. I never really understood exactly what the point of the film was except for show a bunch of predictable and lazy so called action scenes that didn't really show the full capabilities of any of the main characters including the parents. If you must watch it, don't expect much excitement. The only good part of this movie was seeing Scar Jo and Florence together in one film.

Author: alexkuzminchik
Review: "Black Widow" is just a miracle of miracles! Much more long-awaited than Zack Snyder's Justice League, a project that was supposed to come out with about the same insignificant probability - when all the crayfish on the mountain will whistle after the rain on Thursday. This movie was requested after the first "Avengers". Yes, what was asked - demanded! As a result, Marvel Studios was honored to make a solo album about Natasha Romanoff only after her death in the canon of the film universe. However, this event had to be postponed for more than a year - the coronavirus, the dog. So true fans really suffered, but still got their movie about a former Russian spy, a former Avengers agent and a former sex symbol of the Marvel universe. The former, because the actress and her character refused all these honorary titles.

Defended the borders of the Communist Party.

Author: wkbndrd
Review: Although the plot as a whole did not meet expectation, the newly introduced characters, along with Natasha, together constructed a family dynamic near unlike any other. Each protagonist stands out in their own light and each get their own chance to steal the show at least once. The action sequences and choreography were stunning and believable. Despite Taskmasters highly underwhelming debut Black Widow was/is another solid new addition to the MCU.

Author: wileybcooper
Review_Title: Pugh and end credits is the only good thing
Review: Florence Pugh carried this film. This was the Marvel equivalent of The Rise Of Skywalker- large buildup, excitement in the fandom, and God-awful execution. The post Credits scene was the only redeeming factor of this film. Whereas people expected the cocky, taunting Taskmaster, they instead got a gender swapped buffoon pretending to be a formidable opponent. Don't get me wrong- I have no problem with the gender swapping ( I love Tilda Swindon as The Ancient One) , I only have a problem when it fails to fulfill hype, or a storyline. To be blunt, I honestly was more pleased with the Taskmaster from the Marvel's Avengers Video Game.

Author: nfs-01226
Review: Black widow had a very strong first half, then it completely derailed. The villain was barely in the movie and was a complete waste. As a female, I love black widow and was so excited for this film. Natasha has always been my favorite superhero, in the comics and in the MCU. I've seen every marvel movie in the cinemas and was literally bouncing off my seat waiting for it to start. Was also so thrilled for the movie to have a female director, finally! But let me tell you, in all honesty I was so disappointed with this movie, and this is coming from someone who was anxiously waiting for a Black Widow movie. Way less action packed than the other MCU movies and the CGI is just meh. The plot is so predictable and sloppy, very flat storytelling. The last act doesn't even feel like something a MCU movie would have, considering how popular and good other MCU movies were. This movie could have been so much better, like the insane opening sequence seemed to imply. However, I loved the comedic and the family moments in the film and those got some good reactions out of me.

Author: madshangaard
Review: Black Widow is a perfectly enjoyable superhero flick. It comes with everything you expect from any Marvel movie. A huge VFX budget, smirkable one-liners and some feel good political correctness. Woo girl power! But Black Widow does nothing to raise itself from the flock and make it alongside the greats such as Ironman, Doctor Strange or Infinity War. The cinematography is fine, the actors are fine, the issue comes with the villain. It seems like the script writers were a little too focused on women good, white man bad, that they forgot to give the villain literally any motivation at all. Just a copy paste evil man with a hidden layer and a legion of faceless goons. The movie has it's moments, but it's too busy being a good superhero movie, and neglects being a good movie in itself.

Author: passioncoachingtraining-88672
Review: Started with real potential but I started drifting off into my dreams about 30 minutes in. Wasn't exactly dynamic, just not bad. Author: ethancolebennett
Review: I enjoyed this movie. It's a little clumsy at times, but I genuinely think this outrage towards the movie is ridiculous. It's pretty campy at some moments and requires you to suspend your disbelief, but the characters were surprisingly compelling. I really do like the dynamic of Natasha's family. Marvel movies tend to follow a formula and I don't think this deviated too much. With that being said, I knew what to expect and was actually kinda surprised. Not every joke works and sometimes you'll be asking "why does everybody have a one liner prepared " but just remembered you're watching a Marvel movie. Despite that, I laughed more than I thought. This element honestly worked in Black Widow's favor as a character, humanizing her and adding depth. This is not a back story , but it tells you what you need to know about her.

Review: Yeah. That's right. Black Widow is no doubt the worst movie ever. I don't know why this movie was made in the first place. It absolutely makes no sense making a movie about a dead Avenger after its death and after the completion of the infinity saga. One of the worst CGI I've ever seen in a marvel movie and in fact in any movie after mummy 2, story is so dispersed and boring, action sequences are good but absolutely no justice to the protagonist or the main villain. I don't know what Marvel was thinking when they decided to make this movie. One star is for action and another for Red Guardian and the post credit scene. Author: zak55
Review_Title: A good character drama held back by the marvel formula
Review: This movie honestly has some of the best character work I've seen recently in a marvel movie. The interpersonal relationships are some of the most compelling and raw that Marvel has produced and had me drawn to the screen for the first two acts. Black Widow and her extremely dysfunctional family are incredibly engaging and the actors do a good job bouncing off of each other. Unfortunately, a movie that would have benefited from a smaller scale is hurt by the studios need to have big stakes and thus the third act turns into a real mess as all the well done character work takes a back seat to action that is at times hard to follow and mess. It can also be riveting, as one fight scene showed. As well, a few good character moments are undercut by Marvel's continuous need to add in humor because they think the same joke told 50 times is still funny. As well, the main villain isn't too captivating and his main minion suffers from the same lack of personality that the Winter Soldier had. The CGI at the end also looks really dodge and hurts the movie. And finally, this movie should have come out years ago, not after this character was already gone. Now, all that being said, this is still fun and humorous movie that is brimming with good character work it's first two acts and the last act is merely mediocre. It's a good movie that could have been more.

Author: djurdjicastevanovic
Review_Title: All in all a fun summer blockbuster
Review: Don't know what's with the low reviews because it's like those guys never watched a MCU movie before. Black Widow is on the same level (if not better than some) as all Marvel movies up to this point. I mean you have some cool action scenes, comedic moments and some great new characters so what the hell did you expect that left you so underwhelmed? Also there's no blatant "women good men bad" ideology or forced diversity pushed down your throat every few minutes so for a MCU Phase 4 that's a great success (honestly those disastrous miniseries made my standards drop by miles), characters aren't just two-dimensional woke checkpoints and the plot is intruguing and actually makes sense. All in all this is undoubtedly 153 times better than those ridiculous Disney + shows and is actually a decent movie so if you're looking for a fun popcorn ride with friends look no further.

Author: elena_borcek
Review: Regardless of great stunt performances and action sequences, Black Widow's fast pace and unusually cringy and cheesy dialogue lowered this movie to plain mediocrity. Florence Pugh outshined Scarlett Johansson a bit, while Harbour and Weisz weren't that memorable. Also much anticipated Taskmaster was completely wasted and so was the appearance of Olga Kurylenko. His interesting "power" of mimic could have been used much more effectively, but they barely scratched it and just skipped right over it. Lorne Balfe's soundtracks lifted movie's scenes with its cold and eerily melodies. It is clear that Black Widow should have come out years ago and was only made to satisfy strenuous fans that have been constantly asking for it. Because of its irrelavency for the MCU timeline (except for the Florence Pugh's caracter), it shouldn't be focused on and fussed aboutfor too long.

Author: mikejordan-54841
Review_Title: Awe-Inspiring, spectacular, fun film for casual MCU fans

One of my more favorite MCU movies. "Awesome" was my reaction leaving the theatre. Black Widow goes from a role-player as an Avenger to a star, but not quite the superstar level many were hoping for. The "new" characters are very likable and well developed throughout the course of the movie.

Review: First off, I'm still annoyed and always will be annoyed about how dirty they did Natasha Romanoff in waiting this long to give her a movie. No hate to Captain Marvel whatsoever, but Natasha has been an idol to so many female MCU fans long before this new modern wave of Marvel Movies. Not only that, but it's chronologically set after Civil War yet released after Endgame/Far From Home. Her character is dead and we all know it - people who don't particularly love the character, or anti-feminists, or casual Marvel fans, would most likely have little to zero interest in paying to watch a movie about a dead character.

Author: gghodge
Review_Title: Not as bad as they would have you believe
Review: I think the one thing that I've learned is not to take too seriously other peoples views on movies. For a start if I'm watching an MCU movie I'm going to expect CGI, fight scenes and people doing stuff that we mere mortals can't do. If I wanted a serious true life story I wouldn't be watching this but if you want a fun couple of hours where belief can be suspended for a while and my expectations are for explosions, people getting bashed, and a few funny lines along the way then this is for you. Okay it's not Hamlet but we learnt a bit more about Natasha and I can see her 'sister' becoming an Avenger in later movies and I think she would do a good job. Don't think about it too deeply. Just sit back and enjoy it for what it is.

Author: schavali
Review: I saw all the low ratings and so I went into the movie with very low expectations, but I am so glad I was wrong to doubt. Sure Natasha was not the only one on screen, and sure the cgi was a lot, but somehow it was really comforting. I have been waiting for this movie as an avid black widow fangirl, so I was really glad that I got the back story that I have been waiting for for so long. Compared to other Marvel movies, this movie doesn't focus on one main person who is extremely set out of becoming hero, this movie focuses on the family, the split, the relationship between the sisters. And that's the reason I rate it so high, because it was such a peaceful movie in midst all the fights and all! The story/plot was a bit weak so that's the reason I took of 2 points. Other than that, I would deff watch again just for the fun of it:)))

Author: grishapanshin
Review: The refreshingly straightforward plot is enlivened by sharp, internal flashbacks, as well as superbly staged episodes of hand-to-hand combat and chase. This makes the film look more like a ripping female entry into the Bourne or Bond franchises. The variety of locations is strikingly deployed to add visual textures, while Shortland does not celebrate violence and does not allow quieter scenes to become frivolous, instead adding dramatic undercurrents and backstories that carefully emphasize the tension between this fractured fake family. It also allows the cast to bring the audience much closer. As always with this character, Johansson combines outrageous physicality with a dark sense of authority, turning an effective killer into someone we like to root for. Her interaction with Pew is amazing, regardless of whether they are fighting with their fists or fighting with tears. And their witty banter is perfectly measured, for example, when Elena teases.

Author: ValiantPrince15
Review: Taskmaster, one of Marvel's best villains is forever changed as a result of Marvel's need to fit characters into their "vision" (pun intended) of reality rather than sticking to the cannon. Why is a mutant with photographic reflexes turned into a computerized program? Obviously down the road some armor wars tie-in will occur. Yet why? In the comics, Taskmaster singlehandedly defeated the Avengers because of his abilities and skill yet now he is an automaton programmed by watching TV to learn his skills. I wonder if Marvel catches the real meaning: is society programmed by watching TV or social media and then acting accordingly? That is subject to individual reflection and perception.

Author: georgechollackoff
Review: The plot is ok. A little slow at first. This type of movies however impress with graphics and audio. The picture quality is good and the action scenes are decent, but the audio is still a big miss. Central channel again gets the most audio when clearly much more could be played thru surround and Atmos. Sadly, Atmos is little represented. The directors should think how an action scene would sound from different angles in the real world. They can intentionally change the angle of view to incorporate off-center sound points. This will be more interactive. The viewer will feel more involved. When a movie has that many scenes with surround and overhead sound, it's truly a waste of opportunity not to be mastered the right way.

Author: Thiccthightera
Review: Few spoilers ahead. If you haven't watched the movie beware I'm going to spoil it for you. Overall Black Widow was an action packed block buster that is a must see for the MCU. At the beginning of the movie this is the most tragic and sorrow filled back story that lasts about 10-20min. The middle of the film is very very slow but necessary for the plot that we knew wasn't going to be a Iron Man film that's almost all action. Some of the CGI was bad but is acceptable considering what the CGI is used for and can be looked past considering its in a few minutes of the film. As we know that the MCU is not going off comic book accuracy and shouldn't be because of how fresh their takes are in the MCU. Between the family bonding you see in the film between Red Guardian, Maria, Black widow and her little sister it makes you feel the emotion through out the film. Between the wonderful song choices and the color choices in many scenes it makes you feel connected with the movie all through out. With the gender bending of Task master and how her "powers" are explained is super fresh and interesting take on this comic book villain. The problems with this movie is that the tricks used are already used in multiple films with Black Widow in them, such as the face disguise as we saw in Captain America and the Winter Solider and then the electric gauntlets like in civil war, the CGI is acceptable with has obvious it was but for marvel movie it was still amazing. Another complaint of mine is that this movie is set in 2016 after Civil War but Natasha is more seasoned in combat than her appearance in Infinity war and end game. It is upsetting that Black widow is no longer in the MCU but her character was amazing in this movie.

Author: graemeangell
Review: This movie had the potential to be up there with best of the MCU, but failed. We had been waiting for a solo Black Widow film since Iron Man 2, and there was already a story to be told. We knew how much Natasha had gone through what made Natasha herself, Marvel here had the groundwork to create a beautiful character piece not only about BW origin, but also to be a movie about how in simplistic terms you're able to learn from your past and not let it define you, in doing so you can grow as a person. I think what makes me so mad is that within the movie all of the groundwork that had been laid was up and abandoned Natasha was haunted by her past, specifically we hear about her "ledger" firstly in Avengers. Loki tries to expose her brokenness, touching how red her ledger is, Clint, Drakov's daughter. Loki wins Natasha breaks turn having a mental breakdown, then...she turns and thanks him for the cooperation. Natasha knows how broken she is and how much she has to her name, but she's grown Clint saw something in her how truly good she was. But in Black Widow, Budapest gets 2 minutes of screen time and the endless bloodshed that haunted Natasha for so long gets turned into a joke. That's all you need to about the writing they don't care anymore and of course we get 3rd act CGI festival also Natasha should've died at least 15 times from falling, but she dies in the future so who cares right? Great work Marvel you butchered an incredible character, continue to torch the past.

Review: Black Widow give some insight and answers to Natasha's background. Ans a number of scattered easter eggs link it to her previous appoearances in the Marvel universe. Many are saying that Johansen's co-star, Pughtwas the better of the two in this outing. To a certain extent that may be true, but there is no doubt that Johansen holds her own throughout. Pugh plays Natashia's "Sister" - at least for several years they were raised together with a Mom and a Dad, the opening scene is in a cofy surburban home in Ohio. Things descend quickly and we pick up the "sisters," long seperated, many years later. Lots of action, as to be expected from a marvel film, and do hang aroud for the tag after the credits, which lets us know there is another film in the works. I enjoyed the filme but had hoped to see more of Natashia's training through her youth. IUt is a worthwhile view, just don't expect it to come up, fully to other Marvel films.

Author: pbtrimbur
Review_Title: Middle of the pack MCU film
Review: Black Widow is a mix of good and bad. First of all, it's nice to have Marvel back on the big screen. Scarlett Johansson and Florence Pugh give excellent performances, especially Pugh. From a story standpoint, I wish the film would have gone more in depth about the Red Room and Natasha's background. I know this wasn't an origin film, but I think the movie would have benefited from greater explanation of the Red Room (instead of pictures describing it). I had high hopes for Taskmaster coming into the film as he is a beloved villain of mine. My only critique is the short amount of screen time we got from the character. The supporting cast of David Harbour and Rachel Weisz did an excellent job and provided some laughs. Overall, it was a pretty average MCU movie that will be worth watching when it pops up on TV. I will say, the mid-credit scene has me excited for Pugh's future in the MCU.

Review_Title: Why black widow is a big regression for Marvel filmmaking and writing wise
Review: Black widow is a film that shows that Marvel doesn't have any merit sure the family dynamic is good and the comedy mostly lands but the thing is that when Natasha goes into her old safe house it's never shown visually that someone might be in there with her instead we are told, also the opening of the film is amazing it's so bold, raw and most importantly it feels real but then we go from there to Synthetic gas that can bring someone out of mind control and an Oder that can prevent violent action being done to the person what? Also this film has extremely bad CGI and the actors are weirdly photographed in a few scenes and this film didn't need so much CGI they could have shot in an actual field talking about the fight with taskmaster also the film is very afraid to delve into its themes and taskmaster became a one dimensional villain with a very deep connection to Natasha's past that is never focused on that much also by the end it's weird that all is forgiven by the end and I really do think Marvel should stop with third act explosion it's getting old do something new something fresh, Feige Get Filmmakers to express there visions instead of you calling the shots let them and stop giving us the same thing again and again and something that is one note and doesn't commit to it's themes and is one note.

Author: Inphinia

Author: carahogan-95894
Review: I'm not a Marvel fan, so maybe that's my problem. At the same time I didn't go in with any preconceived notions of what these characters should be like, and only developed an opinion on what I expected from them based on what this one film was telling me and was very disappointed to find out it lied to me at every turn. The family stuff is only a front for the completely nonsensical plot this film has. The only thing that puts the two sisters together is illogical choices and huge amounts of plot armor. The main character is wanted for some crimes that are talked about on the radio and that have her heading to a safe house. Yet, when the plot of this movie kicks in, she behaves like she doesn't have anything to worry about because she doesn't know anything about what her sister is involved in. Fortunately, everyone who want her for whatever reasons that deal with her specifically keep their distance, and the only danger to her is from the people who are after her sister, allowing her to just travel all over the place and only get attacked by her sister's enemies. While I do get the sense that she and her sister are top-notch fighters, I thought they were humans. Actually, I looked it up and they are. And, yet, the insane amount of damage they survive turns the actions scenes into a joke and the villain, who makes a very impressive entrance, ends up being defanged rather early due to not being able to cause any sort of damage to these indestructible heroes. And it's not for lack of missing the target. I think Natasha alone gets blown up at least twice, her sister at least once, while also falling from insane heights, thrown around like rag dolls, and sprayed with bullets. Meanwhile, from what I can see, the younger sister has the means to create an army of "sisters" with the MacGuffin. The woman who had the MacGuffin even told her to do that. The only reason her and Natasha team up is to bolt Black Widow onto the story when, in fact, as intelligent as these women are presented, neither Natasha or Yelena would have made the choices they did to team up. And if they had, they would have been killed or captured long before they could even lay eyes on each other. Not to mention that the Black Widows as a whole have the rather unfortunate habit of just announcing their presence in the most loud and destructive ways possible wherever they go. They should be plastered all over the front page of every major newspaper in the world. And, finally, there's a reason this movie is more popular among females. Well, I'm a female and I have your back, males. No one is sexist who complains about these super heroes. The movie just forgot to tell anyone that these super heroes may be female, but not they're not female humans, no matter what they say.

Author: wheeledgoat
Review_Title: good for one view, but WHAT HAPPENED IN BUDAPEST?
Review: Average flick, don't worry if you miss it, but if you're a Marvel fan it's worth one watch. Speaking of Marvel fans, even casual ones will be familiar with Clint and Natasha bantering "We remember Budapest very differently". I wouldn't bet the farm that this film would pay off on that wonderful tease, and when they made a point of how the characters pronounce Budapest, and the movie spent most of its time there, I couldn't wait! But no. No payoff. Nothing. It was good for a popcorn flick but Marvel's best? This ain't. The best thing I can say about it is the nearly-all-female cast and the constant, well deserved pot-shots at masculinity that are peppered throughout. But as another reviewer noted, it all just feels so forced.

Well, with that day finally here, and a $215 million world-wide opening weekend, it's easy to say that everyone who either flocked back to the theaters, or caught the film through premier access on Disney+, was eager to see the official launch of phase four's feature films.

Author: venkman-11026
Review_Title: Very strange is the result, not great, but interesting and fun.
Review: Very strange is the result of black widow. Marvel movies are not my cup of tea, but someone is very successful, like Iron Man, The Avengers or Guardians of the Galaxy. The other films of the saga very often fall into the very forgettable. We do not know how touches their subject in an interesting way, as was the case at times with Captain America: The Winter Soldier. Black Window is on this point above, almost reaching the top of the basket, a story sometimes unexpected, sometimes unsurprising. A tribute to james bond femme fatale version, we feel the potential to touch strong subjects such as the abyss of destructive patriarchy. Yet full of good ideas, the film does not really manage to treat the whole and become a master stallion, whereas with a little more time and less unsightly spectacular, when the family reunites before the final confrontation, the film shows that he could have been very strong. Instead, he hovers over, gives compelling reasons to connect the pieces with the saga and ticks the boxes of the blockbuster marvel without conviction. This is how the film scuttles itself, not knowing how to take these distances with Avenger. In fact it's a bit of a mess, but at times it offers a real good time, special mention to Yelena Belova, actress Florence Pugh is really what we will remember.

Author: acejkamccullough
Review_Title: Very little action for a Marvel movie and terrible end credit scene.
Review: I wish this movie had MORE action to it, like I get the movie was based off of Natasha's Life, but Cmon, its marvel, was disappointed that there wasnt more action.

Author: zbyshekposelsky
Review: It was very confusing and boring. I actually fell asleep in the middle of the movie, which never happens to me! It was that boring... Acting is very mediocre, the characters are very superficial... This is by far the worst Marvel movie ever.

Author: khvichcha
Review: After watching it, it's hard to get rid of the feeling that The Widow was released too early and too late at the same time. Attempts to film Romanoff have been delayed several times. In 2006, high competition prevented: then the fashion for spy action movies with women in the lead roles just went. In 2016, Kevin Feige did not include the project in the next release schedule, concentrating on other films (including solo ones). Studios delayed the release of the picture right up to the Fourth Phase of the MCU. And Natasha Romanoff from the events of Avengers: Endgame (that is, even from the Third Phase) is considered dead.

Author: jesuslostthegame
Review_Title: You don't need to watch this one.
Review: This character should've stayed dead after Endgame.

Author: vancew-35882
Review: Though the storyline of black widow is not nearly as interesting or gripping as it could have been, it still does just enough to justify it's existence .

Author: maybellinern
Review: I couldn't watch this movie it was so boring. I forced myself to sit through 45 minutes it never got any better.

Author: ihabkoura
Review_Title: this is my first review on IMDB.
Review: After all the hundreds of action movies.. i saw Balanced movie among all the other avengers , action melted with intelligent ideas plus fair dramatic scenes.. not amazing but unexpected fair script with logical steps + flashback .. at last I was focused without wondering putting the scenario together..

Author: adimarov
Review: I did not know if I want to watch it to the end. Just wasted time. There were really interesting Marvell movies before... This is not the one of them.

Author: hassen_yagoubi
Review: A story that was not at the level...poor in terms of action, knowing that the Avengers company focuses a lot on action and visual effects.

Author: markkauffman2000
Review: It could have been worse. Not much. The story line was choppy. The bad guy had no character, just your generic "I'll do anything to rule the world" guy. Stan is over in his grave. Lots of action, good actors, that's about it.
